title: 1899-A
statement: A. Game with Integerstime limit per test1 secondmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputVanya and Vova are playing a game. Players are given an integer $$$n$$$. On their turn, the player can add $$$1$$$ to the current integer or subtract $$$1$$$. The players take turns; Vanya starts. IfafterVanya's move the integer is divisible by $$$3$$$, then he wins. If $$$10$$$ moves have passed and Vanya has not won, then Vova wins.Write a program that, based on the integer $$$n$$$, determines who will win if both players play optimally.InputThe first line contains the integer $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \\leq t \\leq 100$$$) — the number of test cases.The single line of each test case contains the integer $$$n$$$ ($$$1 \\leq n \\leq 1000$$$).OutputFor each test case, print "First" without quotes if Vanya wins, and "Second" without quotes if Vova wins.ExampleInput61351009991000OutputFirst Second First First Second First

processed.result: Two players take turns modifying an integer.  On each turn, a player can add 1 to the integer or subtract 1 from the integer. The first player to make the integer divisible by 3 wins. If 10 turns have passed and the integer is not divisible by 3, the second player wins. Given an integer, determine which player will win if both players play optimally.

Two players take turns adding or subtracting 1 from a number. The first player to make the number divisible by 3 wins. If the number doesn't become divisible by 3 after 10 turns, the second player wins. Determine the winner if both players play optimally.
